wikipedia_page.main:
James King-King (6 November 1806 – 17 June 1881) was a British Conservative Party politician.
King-King was the eldest son of James Simpkinson King (1767–1842) and Emma, daughter of Edward Vaux. He studied at Balliol College, Oxford, receiving a Bachelor of Arts in 1829. In 1835, he married Mary Cochrane Mackenzie, daughter of Kenneth Francis Mackenzie. Together they had three sons and seven daughters.He was elected MP for Herefordshire in 1852 and held the seat until 1868.King-King was also a Justice of the Peace, a Deputy Lieutenant and, in 1845, High Sheriff of Herefordshire. His family seat was Stanton Park at Staunton on Arrow, where he was a major landowner and lord of the manor.
